# Analyse de base pour le Tchad
Dernière mise à jour `r Sys.Date()`

<br>

```{r setup, include = FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE}
source("tcd_risk_data_summary.R")
library(kableExtra)
library(knitr)
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE) # do not print code by default
knitr::opts_chunk$set(include = FALSE) # do not print output by default
```

Ce rapport présente une exploration sommaire des risques et vulnérabilités humanitaries au Tchad. Des données sont compilées et présentées sur ces sujets:

- [Risque d'inondations](https://geonode.wfp.org/layers/geonode%3Atcd_ica_floodrisk_geonode_mar2017)
- [Risque de sécheresse](https://geonode.wfp.org/layers/geonode%3Atcd_ica_droughtrisk_geonode_mar2017)
- [Risque de chocs naturels](https://geonode.wfp.org/layers/geonode%3Atcd_ica_naturalshocksrisk_geonode_mar2017)
- [Analyse ICA](https://geonode.wfp.org/layers/geonode%3Atcd_ica_categories_areas_geonode_mar2017)
- [Population](https://data.humdata.org/dataset/population-statistics-of-chad)
- [Internally displaced persons](https://data.humdata.org/dataset/population-au-tchad-et-total-idps-retournes-refugies-sadd)
- [Food security](https://data.humdata.org/dataset/cadre-harmonise)
- [Poverty](https://data.humdata.org/dataset/chad-mpi)
- [Operational presence](https://data.humdata.org/dataset/chad-operational-presence)
- [Seasonal precipitation forecast](https://iri.columbia.edu/our-expertise/climate/forecasts/seasonal-climate-forecasts/)

L'analyse ICA (Integrated Context Analysis) montre les aires de convergence de hauts niveaux de récurrence de l'insécurité alimentaire et la propensité majeure aux chocs naturels (inondations, sécheresses, glissements de terrain). L'analyse de risques de chocs naturels en est découlée. Ces analyses de 2017 furent un effort conjoint entre le Bureau Régional du Programme d'Alimentation Mondiale à Dakar (RBD), de leur Unité en Analyse Géospatiale (GIS) du bureau-mère et de leur division Programme.


***

Ces facteurs varient par région comme on peut le voir ci-bas. 

## Geographic overview of key factors

The North-Eastern regions of Burkina Faso (eg. Sahel, Centre-Nord) are more vulnerable, with high flood and drought risk. These regions also have a population more vulnerable to food insecurity and larger number of IDPs relative to the rest of the country. The country's humanitarian presence is also most focused on these regions.


```{r maps, dpi=300, include=T, message= FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.height=8, fig.align="center"}

combine_map(shp_sum)

```

## Tabular overview of key factors


```{r, include=T}

df_sum_display %>%
  knitr::kable(caption = "Risk, vulnerability, and capacity factors by region",
               col.names = c('Region', 'Humanitarian activities', 'IDPs', 'Multidimensional\npoverty index', 'Drought risk', 'Flood risk', 'Total population\n', 'IPC Phase 3+'),
               align = c('l', 'l', 'l', 'l', 'l', 'l', 'l', 'l')) %>%
        collapse_rows(columns = 1, valign = "top") %>%
        kable_styling(bootstrap_options = c("striped", "hover", "condensed", "responsive"),
                      fixed_thead = T) 

```

## Populations facing high hazard risk

We see a greater total population in regions facing high flooding risk. By this factor alone, we could perhaps estimate that flooding would have a larger humanitarian impact.


```{r, include=T}

high_hazard %>%
  knitr::kable(caption = "Populations vulnerable to high hazard risk",
               col.names = c('Total population','Men over 60', 'Women over 60', 'IDPs'),
               align = c('l', 'l', 'l', 'l')) %>%
        collapse_rows(columns = 1, valign = "top") %>%
        kable_styling(bootstrap_options = c("striped", "hover", "condensed", "responsive"),
                      fixed_thead = T)

```
